reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Read BEFORE your parent passes away
reviews.reviewText: I read this AFTER my father died, and even though he was very different from Alice’s, we would have both benefitted from my having read this. I would have asked more meaningful questions, thought about things differently…hopefully, understood our relationship better. As far as the writing itself: fresh and beautiful. I loved how Alice, and the author, stayed true to Leonard with no miracles or tidy endings. It’s a book that will stay with me - I read a lot so that’s quite a compliment. And I am gifting it to my best friend and my sister who do not appreciate time-travel stories, but I think will appreciate this. Oh - and to my my daughter who turns 40 this year!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book was a companion while I'm waiting to get over being sick. I love time travel based stories and it had been in my list to read for a while. It was a cool take and I found myself getting attached to the protagonist (Alice). It was good enough to have a hard time putting it down. If you enjoy the idea of "what if" time travel I think you'll like this. If I had one critique, it would be that I wished the book was a little longer and got more into the results and consequences of Alice's decisions. I also found myself wondering a bit about that cat. I think there's some unspoken things going on there.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars A reasonably good time travel themed novel.
reviews.reviewText: When I read the publisher's brief synopsis of this novel, I immediately purchased the Kindle version because I am a fan of this genre. I thought it to be a novel twist on the time travel theme, and I did enjoy the book. However, I didn't love the book. These time travel novels tend to be very exciting and move quickly through the plot. That was not the case with "This Time Tomorrow." I felt the plot dragged on in the last half of the story, and I don't believe that the story was well served by the protagonist's pity party attitude throughout the last half of the book. Nevertheless, I do recommend this book if you are a fan of the genre.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 16, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Worth Sticking it Out
reviews.reviewText: I don’t normally like time travel books, so when I got to the point where it became apparent that time travel was going to be a big part of it, I almost stopped reading. But since Alice and her Dad were so appealing, I decided to give it a shot. Without giving away any spoilers, let me just say that there is a lot more to this book and I ended up really enjoying it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book was selected by my Book Group. I really enjoyed the very specific New York references since I used to live there--even on the West Side. Her "obscure" NY references were especially fun for me, for example she mentions the linen shop where I had a bedspread made! The overall premise of time travel is less appealing to me and I found that at times it was a little confusing and that it also got a little silly. I, personally wouldn't recommend it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 28, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Enjoyed it, interesting to see different versions of a life.
reviews.reviewText: Enjoyed the book, the author describes NYC life well, and the dynamics of privileged private school high school life. What made me pick up the book was the idea of going back to being 16 to change a few things. Who wouldn’t want to do that?

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 17, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A lovely story about love, coming of age, and hope
reviews.reviewText: 4.5 stars. This story touched my heart in ways I did not expect. The ability to time travel and do or undo things in hopes of making life for you or your loved ones better. Even more so, the ability to live the days with your loved ones which you thought were long gone. Having lost both of my parents, I would go back without question to those special moments that at the time I didn’t realize how special they were. To see their smile, to see them young again, to see them living their life that I am now living as an adult. There is so much I took for granted. But isn’t that what this book is about? To look back and appreciate what we had, but to learn from our past, know when to let go, and start looking forward to the future, whatever it is going to be?I have to end with this quote from the book: “Happy endings were too much for some people, false and cheap, but hope—hope was honest. Hope was good.” After reading this book, I feel hope. Hope is good.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars lack of character development
reviews.reviewText: I liked the concepts, the cat, her best friend and her father. But Alice herself is listless and bland. There is no character arc. Writer needs to work on this. The book falls flat. How could she give up her house and the cat?
I think the last part of the novel was weak.

reviews.reviewTitle: Quase não terminei de ler, mas a mensagem do livro é bonita
reviews.reviewText: Gostei do tema e da mensagem, mas não gostei da forma como foi escrito

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on September 19, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Made me think about what we’re the best times in my life, would I like to relive them or just moments forward
Das Buch wurde leider in diesem Zustand geliefert.
J'ai acheté ce roman parce que j'avais aimé les autres livres d'Emma Straub - mais là, quelle déception. Insipide, ennuyeux... c'est un roman à l'eau de rose.
